info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 1:47PM CDT until September 24 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central Arkansas, including the following county, southeastern Union and Louisiana, including the following parishes, east central Claiborne, Lincoln, west central Ouachita and southeastern Union.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches, with isolated higher amounts, are expected over the area through late afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruston, Claiborne, Grambling, Junction City, Farmerville, Bernice, Strong, Cooley, Urbana, Lapile, Lawson, Dubach, Choudrant, Simsboro, Marion, Vienna, Lisbon, Downsville and Spearsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
